body.p:
Your petitioner George A Garrett States that at the September Term 1860 a judgment was rendered against him on a forfeited bail bond as security for his son Ed Garrett for the sum of $300, the facts of the forfeiture were stated in a petition to your excellency a short time after the said judgment, that your excellency respited the said judgment for twelve months from the 16th of Oct 1860. Your petitioner states that said judgment is still unsettle except the costs & officers fees, he states that it is a hard case to compell him to pay the same that he is poor and has a large family to support, that his son Ed Garrett is now in custody on bail and has been for the last eight months for the same charge but has not yet had a trial, that he was under forced to leave home and forfeit his bail in consequence of a mob that threatened to take his life, but after the danger of the mob was over returned to answer the charge,
the petitioner prays that the said judgment be remitted and he will ever pray &c
Sworn to before the undersigned this 4th of Nov 1861
We join in the above prayer for a remission of the said judgement
